fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12635].
  {panel}

The 'Raise Support Request' action is awesome. Though I haven't used it much, it seems to get us most if not all the information we could want/need to start resolving a problem situation:

http://localhost:8080/confluence/admin/raisesupportrequest.action

(The action that actually calls the request-creating action is called 'doraisesupportrequest.action'. The above action just displays the web page.)

Sometimes either Confluence is down completely or is just malfunctioning for any number of reasons (corrupt db) - it would be nice if i could tell a customer to just go into their 'bin' directory and run the 'raisesupportrequest.sh' script. The script might ask a quick question or two and then ask for confirmation that they wanted to submit a support request before actually sending the request. We might ask whether they want to use a configured mail server or the local mail user agent/mta (e.g. /usr/bin/mail), or even if they want us to zip the info packet into a zip on the filesystem that they could then get to us however they wanted.

Maybe it's possible to try and re-use the RaiseSupportRequestAction.java class. Things we might have to do:
1) Get path to java (using $JAVA_HOME, etc.)
2) Set up classpath
3) set up shell-script wrapper to ask at least one question ('Are you sure you want to submit a support request?').
4) Possibly do the add-on question for asking about which mail client/server to use.

This makes support easier on the end user, makes the Support Department more efficient (b/c we get the info we need, and we get it quickly, without spending time on the phone), and should ultimately make us more effective.

In theory, this could be relatively easy to accomplish.
fields.summary: Make 'Raise Support Request' functionality available via command-line, too -- in case (web-based) Confluence is not accessible

fields.description:
I found many occurences of this error in our logs: {noformat} ERROR 2008-07-30 14:43:01,638 [service-j2ee-12] WikiExporter:exportWikiToXslFo - Error while generating XSL-FO for 'Restricted:pdf export test' -- url: /wikis/pages/doexportpage.action | userName: igorminar | action: doexportpage | page: 11468802 com.atlassian.confluence.renderer.WikiRenderException: Can not transform XHTML to XSL-FO due to an error in the following XHTML null at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.WikiExporter.convertXHtmlToXslFo(WikiExporter.java:213) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.WikiExporter.exportWikiToXslFo(WikiExporter.java:143) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.WikiExporter.exportWikiToXslFo(WikiExporter.java:102) ... ... Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.dom4j.io.DOMReader.read(DOMReader.java:86) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.WikiExporter.initializeXHtml(WikiExporter.java:230) at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.WikiExporter.convertXHtmlToXslFo(WikiExporter.java:178) ... 143 more {noformat} I was able to narrow it down to: {noformat} h1.{panel:title=Foo}{panel} {noformat} Which generates: {noformat}

{noformat} This invalid html is then being processed through JTidy, but even JTidy is not able make sense of it and returns null, which is not expected by Confluence and therefore Confluence throws an error. IMO this is a user and JTidy error, but I think that Confluence should be able to handle the situation more gracefully. Showing a stacktrace when user is trying to export a page or an entire space is not going to tell him that the input is incorrect.
fields.summary: PDF Exporter doesn't handle situations when JTidy fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12633].
  {panel}

I feel like the 'Logging and Profiling' screen of the Administration interface should be persisted as soon as they are made, by default. If we want to provide a special 'Only change this in memory and do not persist'-type button, then that would be fine, but I would expect that the default behavior would and should be to persist any changes made (across server restarts).

Here is current documentation on Logging and Profiling settings:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF27/Working+with+Confluence+Logs#WorkingwithConfluenceLogs-FindingtheLogConfigurationFile

In the future I suppose we could allow folks to save particular logging/profiling 'configurations'.

With this change, I believe we should just get rid of the 'Save' button, as it would become superfluous. Again, any change you make would be persistent, by default, so using the 'Add Entry' button, for instance, would create/update a logging level that is changed immediately for runtime, but also changed permanently.

And this 'changes are persisted by default' philosophy would hold for the whole page - profiling, logging, etc.
fields.summary: Logging and Profiling changes should be persisted across Confluence restarts (Administration screens)

fields.description: When having umlauts in headings, the TOC displays wrong characters
fields.summary: TOC macro fails displaying umlauts

** Increased the priority of this because I just realized that our site is now unusable.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12630].
  {panel}

It would be useful if the Remote API could be extended to allow for querying of a particular user's favourites. Something along the lines of 

Vector getUserFavourites(String token, String username)

The ability to add a favourite for a specified username via the API would also be a useful feature but should be considered secondary to the issue of extracting the favourites.

Our motivation behind this improvement request is that we have a centralised bookmark repository, think del.icio.us, and would like to aggregate Confluence favourites into it.
fields.summary: Access to user favourites via the Remote API

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+System+Files+and+Data+Storage

Off the top of my head (some developer investigation will probably be required to get the full facts):

* Logs are now put in conf-home
* {{default-formatting.properties}} might be obselete (check?)
* Attachments may be stored in database 
* Custom page layouts are now in the database
* Plugins are now stored in database, and there is no documentation of {{plugin-cache}} and {{bundled-plugins}} directories
fields.summary: Documentation of files stored in confluence-home is out of date

fields.description:
The pagination actions are still loading all of the items into memory rather than only those viewable from a page. Pagination only occurs AFTER all of these items are loaded.

Affected actions
* Alphabetical page list
* Mail archive
* Labels by space
* Orphaned pages
* Undefined pages
* Permission pages
fields.summary: Pagination actions don't paginate

Should be easy to fix.

The Create SMTP Mail Server screen should suggest what to use for the 'From:' address (e.g. 'someone@somewhere.com', or 'Peter Smith <someone@somewhere.com>') -- whatever actually works in there, because there are plenty of possibilities.

Easy fix - big gain in usability.

This is also in the 'Edit SMTP Mail Server' screen as well.

fields.description:

Clicking on a team label name, the Dashboard's Team tab should open with the clicked team label selected.

Instead, it simply opens the Dashboard in its last seen status.

The problem might be that the team label links in Space Details open  {{homepage.action}} instead of {{dashboard.action}}

Add more functionality to Group Members page
Documentation regarding impresence plugin usage with gtalk

fields.description:
Administrators with  Confluence Administrator permission can enable 'Anonymous Access' to the site.  

Users think that this can compromise the security of the Confluence system.
 
The concept of a Confluence Administrator is a great idea however this role may have a bit too much access.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Issues+resolved+in+Confluence+2.8

The jira-issues box has a horizontal scrollbar. If I drag it to the right very right, often I can't drag it to the left anymore without lifting and reclicking the mouse-button onto the scrollbar.

Also the scrolling is sometimes really slow, it stops and resumes intermittently, as if some JS-logic kicked it. This makes the new issues-macro less usable than the old "normal" one.

JIRA Issues Macro For Anonymous Saved Filter Displays No Results

Add a view that displays all long running tasks

2. try to use auto completion , but don't choose any author
3. increase font
4. try to use auto completion

See screenshot.

  {panel}

fields.description:
Java script error when posting news item. Although it is more visible in IE than other browser, this is not browser specific but an error in the Java script.
To help track of this error, one might need to use an appropriate tool such as [Debugbar|http://www.debugbar.com/?langage=en] and install it with IE. Make sure that the Java Script error notification is turned on.

Step to replicate:
- Open any space using Internet Explorer
- Click on "Add News"
- Enter a title and content
- To see the error you can either click on "Save" or "Cancel"

{noformat}
-------------
Script Error:
//----------------
Line: 3234
Character: 5
Code: 0
Error Message: 'target' is null or not an object
URL: http://localhost:8080/pages/createblogpost.action?spaceKey=sand
//---------------- 
{noformat}


The error does not seem to be replicate able in Confluence 2.9
fields.summary: Java Script Error when posting news in Confluence

fields.description:
Currently we have a hack in the ConfluenceBootstrappedContextLoaderListener that sets up a delegate classloader for Spring (and the plugin system) to use.

Unfortunately, ConfluenceBootstrappedContextLoaderListener only starts up the Spring context if Confluence setup is complete. Otherwise all it does is put a ContextLoader into the ContainerManager.  Later on, once Hibernate has been configured, the setup process calls ContainerManager.getInstance().getContainerContext().refresh(), which brings up the Spring context but does NOT do any of the classloader hackery.

This means the classloader thing only applies after the first time Confluence is restarted.
fields.summary: Spring classloading hack is only applied if Confluence is restarted after setup

fields.description: With the implementation of CONF-9627 we should move to enable the automatic HTML entity encoding behaviour by default. Once this is done and developers are happy with the outcome, we can start removing the explict calls to {{htmlEncode}} in earnest.
fields.summary: Enable automatic HTML encoding by default

fields.description: Under Firefox 2.0.0.x, the left - right scroll bar fixed to the jira issues macro box stays contained in that the scroll bar is attached to the jira issue macro box.  However, under Firefox3, Safari, IE6, the scroll bar is extended to the browser in that the jira issues macro box is completely expanded with no left - right scroll attached to it.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro displays too wide, doesn't auto-scroll properly

fields.description: The ability to embed PDF documents into a Confluence page, much like can already be done with .mov and other file extensions. PDF's are a very popular media and many programs output in PDF format. Being able to directly view these PDF's from Confluence instead of having to launch a reader would save time and simplify the process.
fields.summary: Embed PDF document in Confluence page

fields.description:
Need the ability to display a PDF file on a Confluence Wiki page. I filed this issue once before and it was lumped into the mass of bugs about EXPORTING to a PDF. THIS IS NOT WHAT I AM TALKING ABOUT! 

Right now, all we can do is link to an attached PDF  and the user has to click the link, download the PDF, open the PDF and then view it. This is a pain! What would be BETTER is to have the PDF viewable ON THE WIKI PAGE complete with all embedded links being active.
fields.summary: Need ability to display a PDF file on a Wiki page.

fields.description:
Confluence will allow a user to create a page title with an open parenthesis and no closed parenthesis, for example: Page (Title.  However, when the page location is changed, the system gives an error.

Confluence should either allow the ability to move pages with an open parenthesis or it should not allow me to create a page with an open parenthesis.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Confluence can not move pages with an open parenthesis in the title

fields.description:
How to reproduce:

# Create new page
# Switch to rich text editor
# Create table
# Create a list within one cell
# Mark that list and copy it to the clipboard
# Position cursor in another empty cell
#* Note: There should be a leading "space" in that cell, this seems to be default for empty cells...
# Paste list into cell
#* Note: There should be an empty row right before the pasted list
# Switch to preview => table will be garbled

This issue might be reported in one of the many other rich text related issues but i did not manage to find it, because those are very hard to survey.
fields.summary: Rich text mode sometimes gets confused with a leading space in front of a list

fields.description:
When completely erasing page content in wiki markup mode and switching to rich text mode afterwards, all the content reappears.

How to reproduce:

# Create new page
# Enter some content
# Switch back and forth between wiki markup, rich text and preview -> content should be visible
# Go to wiki markup mode
# Erase all content
# Go to rich text mode
# => *all the content re-appears*
fields.summary: In wiki markup-mode completely erased content reappears in rich text-mode

fields.description:
Labels starting with non-alphanumeric characters (e.g. '_', '=', '-') are not shown by:

* {{listlabels}} macro
* "all labels" section of space labels tab
fields.summary: listlabels macro and labels tab do not show labels starting with non-alphanumeric character

fields.description:
Account request for

John Edward David
SE LPMH
LAWSON PSSC

email:john.david@lawson.com

fields.summary: Account request for Confluence/Lawson Wiki

fields.description:
The following page is not viewable by normal, registered users:

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Cookies
fields.summary: Remove restriction for page "Confluence Cookies"
Consider all entered data in author filter field e.g. "Jeff L"
Author filtering should provide information in hits about contributor to that hit

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have "Author" and "Last Modified by" fields associated with user macros, layouts and templates, similar to a page in Confluence.
This will make it easy for users to contact the people responsible for the customizations, in terms of the above three factors, on their instance.
fields.summary: Add author and last updated by fields for user macros, templates and layouts

fields.description:
The author filtering work done for Confluence 2.9 search screen is not usable in the hosted environment. For a couple of reasons I believe -

1) PersonalInformation objects are not indexed
2) Even if PersonalInformation was indexed the auto-complete box would be offering all users on that instance. This would be a security leak in the hosted environment.

I had a quick chat with Jens and off the top of his head he suggests that indexing 'SpaceGroups' along with the PersonalInformation and filtering the search of PersonalInformation documents by SpaceGroups may solve the issue.
fields.summary: Make author filtering in search screen usable in hosted environment

fields.description:
Here are the steps...

- I hide the comments on a page.
- I then hide the children on a page - Confluence then shows the comments again.

Bug?
fields.summary: Show/Hide Bug on Page

fields.description:
I couldn't find any other references to this bug and I've only confirmed it for Confluence 2.7. I've attached a Space export to demonstrate the issue in Confluence 2.7. To replicate the bug, go to the "Wiki Markup Demo" page and select "view change", then "<< Changes from 5 to 6" and it automatically jumps back to the first version of the page. The breadcrumb also changes to say "Dashboard > Undefined Space > Wiki Markup Demo > Information".

Let me know if you need further information to replicate, I've also confirmed the issue exists on the other page in this space ("Rich Text Demo") but haven't checked later versions of Confluence
fields.summary: Comparing versions going straight to version 1
Create Multiple Drafts of News/Pages
listlabels macro should be able to list the labels for an individual page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12553].
  {panel}

Live Search Macro causes Cross Domain warning (in IE only)  when Confluence is using SSL and Server Base URL is not set to https. For example, user is accessing Confluence via https://confluence.abc.com , but server base url is set to http://confluence.abc.com.

When performing a search in a space (Live Search Macro), IE   generates the warning:

-  "This page is accessing information that is not under its control . This poses a security risk. Do you want to continue?'

The warning is coming from the fact that they are executing AJAX across a different domain (from https to http).  

The macor shoud be improved to  point to https://... instead of http://.
fields.summary: Live Search Macro causes Cross Domain warning  when using SSL

fields.description:
I just upgraded from 2.8.1 to 2.8.2, and the "Task List Macros" plugin got enabled even though I had it disabled in 2.8.1 to fix the problem reported in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11741.

DESIRED BEHAVIOR: disabled modules stay disabled.
fields.summary: "Task List Macros" got enabled during upgrade

I am trying to move my confluence database from Microsoft 2003 server and MSSQL to a new server which is running
Ubuntu server 8.04 and MYSQL. The restore fails with this error:

It contained: config/plugin-repository-global.xml, entities.xml, resources/AMI/Amitelo.JPG, resources/Bulgaria/Industria-Bulgaria-heading.png, resources/Bulgaria/Industria-Bulgaria.png, resources/Bulgaria/Thumbs.db, resources/BUST/sumarhus.png, resources/BUST/Thumbs.db, resources/China/ChinaOffice.png, resources/China/Industria-China-heading.png, resources/China/Thumbs.db, resources/Collab/profile_metrics_logo.gif, resources/Collab/Thumbs.db, resources/comx/comx logo.png, resources/DS/Industria Dreamstation logo for wiki.jpg, resources/DS/Thumbs.db, resources/DSBIZ/DS Logo (trans).gif, resources/DSBIZ/DS Logo 185x40.jpg, resources/DSBIZ/Thumbs.db, resources/fornebu/Industria Logo.jpg, resources/GOOGLE/Logo_50wht.gif, resources/Hannes/Halli2.jpg, resources/IceCell/IceCell.jpg, resources/ICESUB/Hibernia_Logo.jpg, resources/IL/Industria_Living_Logo.gif, resources/Industria Logo 2.PNG, resources/Industria Logo 200x34.jpg, resources/Industria.gif, resources/industria_logo.GIF, resources/Inuk/inuk-logo.gif, resources/Magnet/Magnet-industria-wiki.png, resources/MAGZIG/Magnet_Industria_logo.png, resources/Media/Industria_Media_Logo.gif, resources/Nova/Nova_space_logo.png, resources/PROMAN/Yin Yang Skype.png, resources/Zignal/zignal-logo.png

I also can't make manually XML backup from my Conflucence administration consol,

fields.summary: Confluence XML backup fails when restoring to new confluence instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12550].
  {panel}

Create a page and it's child.

Restrict that page to a user or group X.
Go to the child page, restrict another user or group,lets say Y not in X. It shows that restrictions have been set for the given user/group.
Actually, Y will not be able to access the child page, as Y does not have access to the parent page.But confluence did not give any message when Y was added to the child page. This is confusion. The permissions up the heirarchy need to be checked while restricting users and a proper message should be given.
fields.summary: Display message in giving restrictions to child page when user does not have access to parent page

fields.description:
{{ConfluenceHomeLocatorForTests}} has a hard coded link to {{/tmp/conf-test}} which means a few things:
* multiple builds can conflict with each other
* performing builds under different user accounts can cause PermissionDeniedErrors
fields.summary: Confluence tests writes to hard coded temporary path causing PermissionDeniedErrors

fields.description:
conversation between matt and per: 

----

Oh, I was under the impression it had been ordered chronologically before? Anyway:

Most of my drafts have blank titles. And when I click the "view conflict" I get an exception:

Cause

> Hi,
>
> We can fix this, but I'm not sure they were ever ordered chronologically. I definitely didn't change it. How certain are you that they were ordered before?
>
> Looks like the upgrade task to clean up drafts ran. It took 15 minutes on atlassian10!
>
> 2008-07-23 03:15:59,518 INFO [main] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.DraftDataCleaningUpgradeTask] doUpgrade Cleaning up
>  11236 invalid drafts.
> 2008-07-23 03:32:44,868 INFO [main] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.DraftDataCleaningUpgradeTask] doUpgrade Finished cl
> eaning up invalid drafts.
>
> I still have some drafts with blank titles showing up though, which shouldn't be happening. Will look into it tomorrow. :/
>
> Cheers,
> Matt
>
> On 23/07/2008, at 20:14 , Per Fragemann wrote:
>
>> no time to raise an issue (ferry). but my drafts don't seem ordered chronologically anymore. looks really crazy. :-)
>>
>> Cheers,
>> Per
>
fields.summary: Drafts on EAC issues: Blank titles &  "view conflict" throws exception
Identify inline mail attachments
Links containing macros with empty body are broken when edited in Rich Text Editor (RTE)
Set up wizard footer says Printed By

fields.description:
When viewing drafts (http://<your wiki domain>/users/viewmydrafts.action) and clicking on *View conflict*:
- If the conflict _does not_ have a title the *View conflict* link would be referring to an action that does not exist (/pages/edit.action). 
- If the conflict _has_ a title, the *View conflict* link would be working as expected (/pages/editpage.action) 

Snippet of the system error:

{noformat}
com.opensymphony.xwork.config.ConfigurationException: There is no Action mapped for namespace /pages and action name edit
    at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionProxy.<init>(DefaultActionProxy.java:72)
Stack Trace:[hide]

com.opensymphony.xwork.config.ConfigurationException: There is no Action mapped for namespace /pages and action name edit
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionProxy.<init>(DefaultActionProxy.java:72)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionProxyFactory.createActionProxy(DefaultActionProxyFactory.java:45)
	at com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher.serviceAction(ServletDispatcher.java:227)
	at com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher.service(ServletDispatcher.java:199)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Viewing a draft conflict in "View my drafts" causes System Error

fields.description: Would be great to have an optimised theme for mobile browsers such as iPhone's Safari to minimise the amount of zooming and scrolling involved in navigating a standard Confluence page.
fields.summary: Theme for mobile browsers
Escape the following in titles & \ : / < > = ?

fields.description: Arabic (right to left) content is not currently supported and should be.
fields.summary: Support Arabic right to left content

fields.description:
It would be nice if Confluence could run in a read-only mode, selectable through the administrative console.

This would make it easy to disable modifying pages when read access should still be possible. Currently, when exporting in preparation for an upgrade we have to involve network operations to disable access to Confluence for the general public but allow access to the administrator.

Additionally, our MySQL cluster failed over to the read-only node today. Every few minutes Confluence stopped working due to cluster safety issues, even though we're not operating in a cluster. We gave up on rebooting until the read-write node recovered.
fields.summary: Ability to run Confluence in 'Read-Only' mode

fields.description:
I'm using the XML-RPC API.  According to 

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Remote+API+Specification#RemoteAPISpecification-PageSummary

the PageSummary object should contain a field named "locks".  It does not.  Instead, it appears to contain a field called "permissions".   I'm not sure what this field signifies, as it is not in the documentation.  

I have included the raw XML data (with the server name redacted for confidentiality) returned from getPages('test') below ("test" is a valid space key on our server).  Can you tell me why the "locks" field is not present, and why the "permissions" field is, and what the data in the permissions field signifies?

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<methodResponse>
<params>
<param>
<value>
<array>
<data>
<value>
<struct>
<member>
<name>
parentId</name>
<value>
0</value>
</member>
<member>
<name>
id</name>
<value>
1867786</value>
</member>
<member>
<name>
 title</name>
<value>
Home</value>
</member>
<member>
<name>
url</name>
<value>
http://[server name redacted]/display/test/Home</value>
</member>
<member>
<name>
permissions</name>
<value>
0</value>
</member>
<member>
<name>
space</name>
<value>
test</value>
</member>
</struct>
</data>
</array>
</value>
</param>
</params>
</methodResponse>
fields.summary: Remote API does not match documentation

fields.description:
The "RSS feed builder" allows creation of feed that has anonymous authentication and also watches my "favourite spaces."

How can an anonymous user have a "favourite" space? O a "personal" space?

The RSS reader should prevent users from creating feeds that cannot work.
fields.summary: Feed builder allows creation of nonsensical RSS feed
Activity Plugin does not show correct values

fields.description: A user with "Create Page" permission is able to restore pages, and news to an earlier version (via Page History). However, a user with "Create News" permission is unable to restore news, let alone pages, to an earlier version.
fields.summary: "Create News" permission does not allow restoring news to earlier versions

fields.description:
Characters such as Ω or ≤ are displayed as # when exported to PDF.

Replicated by exporting page to PDF containing "m² Ω ≤ ±". The 1st and 4th character display correctly, the 2nd and 3rd are replaced with #.
fields.summary: Some Unicode/Special Characters are displayed as # when exported to PDF
Multiple label search fails under Websphere 6.1

fields.description:
Adding a space with a duplicate space key (upper case), breaks the style and no error message is reported for a duplicate space key. The page simply reloads and no new space is created.
Please see the attached screenshot for more details.
fields.summary: Duplicate space key is not reported correctly when using upper-case keys

fields.description: Upgrade confluence dependency to latest atlassian-plugins (which is 2.0.0.beta6)
fields.summary: Upgrade Confluence to Use Atlassian-Plugins 2.0.0.beta6

fields.description:
i got a notification email in french, with such text as "En réponse à un commentaire de Charles Miller:". i bet Samuel Le Berrigaud, who made the comment, has his language set to french. 

or maybe eac was switched to french language default very briefly?
fields.summary: Notification in wrong language

fields.description:
Even with the box checked, users are getting email when they:

1. Change the page name, but not the content.
2. Move the page.
fields.summary: Notification emails sent to watchers even with "minor change" checked

fields.description: While trying to attach a document to the phrase "J&J Rivaroxaban Internal Portal", only the text before "&" (J) is displayed in the Alias field of the linking property screen.
fields.summary: Unable to embed a URL or link to an attachment If the text contains an "&".

fields.description:
I have a hard time telling when I am watching a page. The envelope image clicking back and forth between watch and not-watch should be more apparent. Maybe it is because I am color blind, but I think it should be more clear. Either do a completely different image, or make the colors contrast way more. Also, when clicking back and forth trying to figure out if I was watching or not - I didn't know what image indicated watch and which one didn't. Maybe the envelope, when clicked on, could change to say: 'Watching.' 

Just ideas.
fields.summary: Confluence 'Watch' Should be more clear

fields.description:
Today, the mails are deleted from the inbox of a mail server when a mail account is integrated.
It should be possible to select, whether the emails are removed from the server or not.
fields.summary: Allow mails to be kept on server when configuring a mail account for integration into a Confluence space

fields.description:
See attached screenshots. There are many things that are rendered poorly and or are mis-aligned in Internet Explorer 7. 

# Items in dropdown menu have 3 different spacing for items with an icon, items without and icon, and items with an icon but added through a plugin
# You can't see it in the screenshot but the cursor does not change to a hand in IE in most places on the item. If you position between the Icon and the text, it will. Otherwise it stays as a text bar cursor. 
# See the add comments UI screenshot. self-explanatory.
fields.summary: Many user interface problems in Internet Explorer 7

fields.description:
If you create a multi-leveled numbered list using ##, when displayed in IE 7.0, it doesn't indent or change number styles. For example

# test
## test another level
fields.summary: Multi-leveled number lists no longer work in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a page called "Test" 
# Create a second page called "Test2"
# "Test2" consist of the following markup:
{noformat}
[{color:green}Test{color:red}|Test]
{noformat}
Macros such as \{tip\} and \{warning\}  are applicable to the above markup too.
# Navigate to "Test2" info page, the "Outgoing Link" section does not include the "Test" page entry.
# Remove the macro leads to the "Test" page entry being included in the "Outgoing Link" section.

*Renaming "Test" page breaks the link available in "Test2" page too*
From step 3 as above:

# Rename "Test" page to say "Test1"
# Navigate to the "Test2" page again
# The link is broken, redirecting to an undefined page link
# If there is no macros across the link alias, changes made reflects immediately
fields.summary: Link alias wrapped in a macro does not reflect the link as outgoing link

fields.description: If user A uploads an attachment and user B later deletes it, the email notification says it was deleted by user A which is incorrect and misleading (specifically, you have no idea of who actually deleted it).
fields.summary: Deleting another user's attachment - notification says it's deleted by the user who uploaded it rather than the user who deleted it

fields.description:
The ContentEntityObject getExcerpt() method removes the hyphen from words.  

This appears to be because when it calls RendererUtil to strip the basic wiki markup it doesn't actually check that the basic formatting chars are next to a space, rather then in the middle of a word before removing them.
fields.summary: ceo.getExcerpt breaks hyphenated words

fields.description:
Twice over the course of the last month or so, my installation of Firefox has started revalidating every linked resource (javascript and css) against the server despite these resources being served with a 10 year expiry policy. Even the {{304 Not Modified}} responses that come back have these expiry headers yet Firefox will revalidate the resources again in subsequent requests. This causes Confluence pages to load very slowly (exacerbated greatly by any latency in the connection). Clearing the cache through Firefox's "Clear Private Data" feature restores proper caching.

I have no steps to reproduce this problem at the moment, but I'm raising this issue to track any future occurances and detail.
fields.summary: Firefox starts revalidating all resources despite expiry setting
Confluence Page Layouts
